intro: Guatteria sagotiana, commonly known as the Mexican huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Mexico and Central America, typically found in humid, tropical lowland forests. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns from green to yellow or red when mature, containing a single seed.
